bibl.title: Letter from Henry Frowde and Hodder & Stoughton to Henry Rose Carter, September 19, 1921

div1.p: The publishing house of Henry Frowde and Hodder & Stoughton sends Carter a prospectus for a new set of books, entitled "The Practice of Medicine in the Tropics."

div1.head: Letter from Henry Frowde and Hodder & Stoughton to Henry Rose Carter, September 19, 1921
div1.opener:
Oxford Press
AWARDED GRAND PRIX
AT THE 17th INTERNATIONAL CONGRESS OF MEDICINE, LONDON, 1913.
OXFORD MEDICAL PUBLICATIONS
OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS. SIR ERNEST HODDER-WILLIAMS, R. PERCY HODDER-WILLIAMS, A CECIL STOUGHTON
Telegrams
OXYMORON
WESTRAND
LONDON
Telephone
4 3 1 4
4 3 1 5
GERRARD
HENRY FROWDE AND HODDER & STOUGHTON
THE LANCET BUILDING, 1 & 2 BEDFORD STREET
LONDON, W.C.2
September 1921.
General H. R. Carter,
U.S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, U.S.A.
Exhibit. B.
Dear Sir,
div1.p:
At the request of the Editor we have much pleasure
in sending you a prospectus of “THE PRACTICE OF MEDICINE IN
THE TROPICS”. Owing to the great expense involved in the
production of this work, we regret we are unable to present
complimentary sets to all those who have written articles,
but we have decided to offer each contributor a set of the
volumes at half the published price. Please let us know
if we may reserve a set for you.
div1.closer:
Yours very faithfully. HENRY FROWDÉ
HODDER & STOUGHTON Answered requesting
copy Oct 23/21:
H R. C
G
Exhibit. B.
